intro: Relhania recurva, commonly known as the African evergreen. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and produces small, white flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets. Relhania recurva is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
